content:
MobileControl Class

In this Article

Provides a base class for all ASP.NET mobile control classes. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.MobileControlDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilter("System.Web.UI")]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilter("System.Web.UI.MobileControls", System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterType.Require)]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder(typeof(System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControlBuilder))]
[System.Web.UI.ParseChildren(false)]
[System.Web.UI.PersistChildren(false)]
public abstract class MobileControl : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.UI.Control
  • MobileControl

Remarks

As the base class for all ASP.NET mobile controls, the MobileControl class primarily contains style and context information common to all controls. For more information about style and context information, see the Style and Form classes.

Note

Because this class derives from the ASP.NET Control base class, all Control base class properties, methods, and events are available in each of the mobile controls.

Constructors summary

MobileControl()

Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

Adapter

Returns the device-specific adapter for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Alignment

Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BackColor

Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BreakAfter

Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. The default is true. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CustomAttributes

Returns the set of custom attributes defined for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
DeviceSpecific

Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
EnableTheming

Gets a value indicating whether themes apply to this control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
FirstPage

Returns the first page of the form on which this control appears. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Font

Gets a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ForeColor

Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Form

Provides access to the containing form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
InnerText

Returns the text inside the control. The inner text might be a combination of text from child controls. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsTemplated

Gets a value indicating whether a MobileControl object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
LastPage

Returns the last page of the form on which the specified control is displayed. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
MobilePage

Returns the containing page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
PaginateChildren

Gets a value that indicates whether the children of the control must be paginated. Used for form pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SkinID

Gets the ID of the skin to apply to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Style

Gets the style of the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
StyleReference

Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
VisibleWeight

Gets the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Wrapping

Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

AddedControl(Control,Int32)

Called after a child control is added to the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection of the Control object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
AddLinkedForms(IList)

Adds the set of forms that contains links to the specified control to the provided list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
AddParsedSubObject(Object)

Notifies the server control that an element, either XML or HTML, was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's ControlCollection object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ApplyStyleSheetSkin(Page)

Applies the style properties defined in the page style sheet to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CreateDefaultTemplatedUI(Boolean)

Called by device adapters to create the default templated user interface (UI) for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CreateStyle()

Constructs and returns the style object to be associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CreateTemplatedUI(Boolean)

Called by base classes to create a templated UI. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
EnsureTemplatedUI()

Use this method to ensure that the templates are instantiated to allow programmatic access to the instantiated contents of a template. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
GetAttribute(String)

Retrieves the specified attribute property from the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
GetTemplate(String)

Returns the template with the specified name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsFormSubmitControl()

Returns true if the control submits the form. The default is false. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsVisibleOnPage(Int32)

Returns whether or not the control is visible on the given page of the form. Used for form pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
LoadPrivateViewState(Object)

Loads private view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
LoadViewState(Object)

Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnDataBinding(EventArgs)

Raises the DataBinding event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnInit(EventArgs)

Raises the Init event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnLoad(EventArgs)

Raises the Unload event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnPageChange(Int32,Int32)

Paginates a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Raises the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnRender(HtmlTextWriter)

Renders a control to the specified output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnUnload(EventArgs)

Raises the Unload event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
PaginateRecursive(ControlPager)

Paginates the control and its children. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RemovedControl(Control)

Called after a child control is removed from the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection of the Control object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Render(HtmlTextWriter)

Sends server control content to a provided HtmlTextWriter object, which writes the content to be rendered on the client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderChildren(HtmlTextWriter)

Outputs the content of a server control's child controls using the provided HtmlTextWriter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ResolveFormReference(String)

Returns the form object referenced by the name parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ResolveUrl(String)

Converts a URL into one that is usable on the requesting client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SavePrivateViewState()

Saves any private view-state changes that have occurred since the page was loaded from persistence. If no changes were made, this method returns null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SaveViewState()

Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SetAttribute(String,String)

Designates an attribute and its value to assign to the MobileControl object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
TrackViewState()

Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute(String)

For a description of this method, see stem.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute(String,String)

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • MobileControl()

    Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected MobileControl ();

Properties

  • Adapter

    Returns the device-specific adapter for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter Adapter { get; }

    Property Value

    • IControlAdapter

      An adapter specific to the device on which the page will be displayed, which is also usually specific to the control.

    Remarks

    The IControlAdapter instance returned is specific to the current MobileControl object. Any child controls of the current control will use their specific adapter as well.

  • Alignment

    Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Alignment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Alignment

      An enumerated value specifying the alignment for the style.

    Remarks

    The Alignment property can be set to any of the following values.

    Value Description
    NotSet No alignment is set for the specified object.
    Alignment.Left Aligns to the left.
    Alignment.Center Aligns to the center.
    Alignment.Right Aligns to the right.
  • BackColor

    Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The specified background color for the style.

    Remarks

    Unlike the other properties, the BackColor property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the BackColor property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit a background color of cyan; you must explicitly set the child control's BackColor property to cyan, or you must set the BackColor property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

  • BreakAfter

    Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. The default is true. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual bool BreakAfter { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Note

    Do not set this property to true on a Form control. If you set this property to true, the control will throw an exception.

    This property is ignored by controls for which a trailing break does not make sense. The following table lists the controls that support the BreakAfter property for certain kinds of devices. The following table shows the controls with the types of devices that support the BreakAfter property. Check with device manufacturers to determine the effects of this property on their devices.

    Control Device With HTML Browser Device With WML Browser Device with WML/UP Browser
    AdRotator
    Calendar Yes
    Command Yes Yes
    Image Yes Yes Yes
    Label Yes Yes Yes
    Link Yes Yes
    List
    ObjectList Yes (unless device's browser can handle tables)
    Panel (default is false) Yes Yes Yes
    PhoneCall Yes Yes
    SelectionList Yes (Unless browser can handle tables) Yes
    TextBox Yes Yes
    TextView Yes Yes
    TextViewElement Yes Yes
    Validator Yes Yes Yes
  • CustomAttributes

    Returns the set of custom attributes defined for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.StateBag CustomAttributes { get; }

    Property Value

    • StateBag

      The set of custom attributes defined for the control.

    Remarks

    You must set the AllowCustomAttributes to true to enable custom attributes.

  • DeviceSpecific

    Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecific DeviceSpecific { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DeviceSpecific

      The DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control, or null if no such construct exists.

  • EnableTheming

    Gets a value indicating whether themes apply to this control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override sealed bool EnableTheming { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Falsein all cases.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      An attempt to set the EnableTheming property is made.

    Remarks

    The MobileControl class does not support theming. If an attempt to set the EnableTheming property is made, a NotSupportedException exception is thrown.

  • FirstPage

    Returns the first page of the form on which this control appears. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public int FirstPage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The first page of the form on which this control appears.

    Remarks

    This property is used for form pagination.

  • Font

    Gets a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo Font { get; }

    Property Value

    • FontInfo

      The FontInfo that contains the font information about the control.

    Remarks

    The FontInfo class has the following properties.

    Property Description
    Bold The font is bold.
    Italic The font is italic.
    Name An identifier for this font instance.
    Size The font size.
  • ForeColor

    Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The specified foreground color for the style.

    Remarks

    You can use the ForeColor property to display text in different colors for all the controls and classes listed in the Inheritance section that follows. For example, in the AdRotator, setting the ForeColor property changes the color of the text in the control; in the Calendar, it changes the color of the text in the calendar; and in the ValidationSummary, it changes the color of the text of the error messages.

    The strings that can be used for colors are a set of fixed colors and hexadecimal RGB values. These values can also be specified in the form "#RRGGBB." For example, "#bb7023".

    You can also use the Microsoft Windows color constants. For specific details, see SystemColors.

  • Form

    Provides access to the containing form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form Form { get; }

    Property Value

    • Form

      The form that contains this control.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the control is not in a form as required. The only mobile controls not required to be in a Form are a Form and a StyleSheet.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Form property to determine whether the active form is a particular form in the ASP.NET mobile Web application. This example is part of a larger example for the EnsureTemplatedUI property.

  • InnerText

    Returns the text inside the control. The inner text might be a combination of text from child controls. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected string InnerText { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The text inside the control.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the inner text contains markup tags at run time, and the derived control does not allow markup tags in inner text.

    • ArgumentException

      the value used to set this property contains new line characters and the derived control does not allow multiple lines of text.

  • IsTemplated

    Gets a value indicating whether a MobileControl object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual bool IsTemplated { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the control has an active template set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    To be considered templated, an object must have a <DeviceSpecific> element with a <Choice> element successfully evaluated for the target device. The selected choice must have templates defined.

  • LastPage

    Returns the last page of the form on which the specified control is displayed. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public int LastPage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The last page of the form on which the specified control is displayed.

    Remarks

    This property is used for form pagination.

  • MobilePage

    Returns the containing page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage MobilePage { get; }

    Property Value

    • MobilePage

      The containing page.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the control is not in a MobilePage. (Only occurs at run time.)

    Remarks

    This property is similar to the Web Forms Page property except that it is strongly typed.

  • PaginateChildren

    Gets a value that indicates whether the children of the control must be paginated. Used for form pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool PaginateChildren { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the children of the control must be paginated; otherwise, false.

  • SkinID

    Gets the ID of the skin to apply to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override sealed string SkinID { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      An empty String object.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      An attempt to set the SkinID property is made.

    Remarks

    The MobileControl class does not support theming. If an attempt to set the SkinID property is made, a NotSupportedException exception is thrown.

  • Style

    Gets the style of the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style Style { get; }

    Property Value

    • Style

      The style of the control.

  • StyleReference

    Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual string StyleReference { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A reference to the style properties for a control.

    Remarks

    The value of the StyleReference property must be the Name property of a Style object. You can use the StyleReference property to share styles across controls, either by using inheritance or by using the StyleReference property of a style sheet. For more information, see the Styles documentation. To find out how to create a new style, see Creating New Styles.

  • VisibleWeight

    Gets the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual int VisibleWeight { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The approximate weight of the control, in characters.

    Remarks

    This property is used for form pagination. A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. For further information, see Pagination Support.

  • Wrapping

    Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping Wrapping { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Wrapping

      An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.

    Remarks

    The following table contains the definitions of the Wrapping enumeration.

    Enumerations Value Description
    NotSet 0 No size is set for the specified object. This is the default value.
    Wrap 1 Wrap to the next line.
    NoWrap 2 The text is not wrapped to the next line.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Wrapping property by setting the FirstFormWrapping property based on the capabilities of the browser. This code sample is part of a larger example for the EnsureTemplatedUI property.

Methods

  • AddedControl(Control,Int32)

    Called after a child control is added to the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection of the Control object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void AddedControl (System.Web.UI.Control control, int index);

    Parameters

    • control
      System.Web.UI.Control

      The Control that has been added.

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the control in the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection.

  • AddLinkedForms(IList)

    Adds the set of forms that contains links to the specified control to the provided list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual void AddLinkedForms (System.Collections.IList linkedForms);

    Parameters

    • linkedForms
      IList

      The set of forms that contain links to the specified control.

    Remarks

    When a form contains navigation elements that activate another form without interaction from the server, it is considered a linked form. There are several criteria for a form to be considered linked. For example, if the following three conditions are met, Form B is considered to be linked to Form A:

    • Form A contains a Link with its destination as Form B.

    • Form A does not contain an OnDeactivate event handler.

    • Form B has no OnActivate event handler.

      The base implementation does nothing, but other controls, such as the Link, override the default implementation.

  • AddParsedSubObject(Object)

    Notifies the server control that an element, either XML or HTML, was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's ControlCollection object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void AddParsedSubObject (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      An Object that represents the parsed element.

  • ApplyStyleSheetSkin(Page)

    Applies the style properties defined in the page style sheet to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override sealed void ApplyStyleSheetSkin (System.Web.UI.Page page);

    Parameters

    • page
      Page

      The Page containing the control.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      In all cases.

    Remarks

    The MobileControl class does not support theming. If an attempt to call the ApplyStyleSheetSkin method is made, a NotSupportedException is thrown.

  • CreateDefaultTemplatedUI(Boolean)

    Called by device adapters to create the default templated user interface (UI) for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual void CreateDefaultTemplatedUI (bool doDataBind);

    Parameters

    • doDataBind
      Boolean

      Set to true if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Set to false if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).

  • CreateStyle()

    Constructs and returns the style object to be associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style CreateStyle ();

    Returns

    • Style

      The style object to be associated with the control.

    Remarks

    Inheriting classes can override this method to return a more specific style class.

  • CreateTemplatedUI(Boolean)

    Called by base classes to create a templated UI. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void CreateTemplatedUI (bool doDataBind);

    Parameters

    • doDataBind
      Boolean

      Returns true if the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Returns false if the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).

    Remarks

    The default implementation calls the CreateTemplatedUI method of the corresponding control adapter, which can in turn call back the control's CreateDefaultTemplatedUI method or create its own device-specific templated UI.

  • EnsureTemplatedUI()

    Use this method to ensure that the templates are instantiated to allow programmatic access to the instantiated contents of a template. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual void EnsureTemplatedUI ();

    Remarks

    This method is overridden by the List and ObjectList classes. 

    public override void EnsureTemplatedUI()

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the EnsureTemplatedUI method to access the contents of the Label1 control within details view of the ObjectList. This complete example also demonstrates several other features of the MobileControl class.

    Note

    The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the ASP.NET Web page code model, see ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model.

  • GetAttribute(String)

    Retrieves the specified attribute property from the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected string GetAttribute (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the server control attribute.

    Returns

    • String

      A String representing the value of the specified attribute; if no attribute with the specified name exists, then null.

    Remarks

    The GetAttribute method returns attributes stored in the CustomAttributes property. If CustomAttributes is null, then GetAttribute will also return null.

  • GetTemplate(String)

    Returns the template with the specified name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.ITemplate GetTemplate (string templateName);

    Parameters

    • templateName
      String

      The name of the specified template.

    Returns

    • ITemplate

      The template with the specified name.

    Remarks

    Returns null if the control is not templated, or if the template does not exist in the selected template set.

  • IsFormSubmitControl()

    Returns true if the control submits the form. The default is false. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool IsFormSubmitControl ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the control submits the form; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Mobile controls, such as the Command, can override this method to determine whether this is a control used for form submission.

    Other controls can be extended by providing logic to programmatically determine whether or not they must be submit controls, for example, by checking for specific properties.

    Note

    A control is considered to be a form-submit control only if it implements IPostBackEventHandler method to capture the postback event. Otherwise, it is not registered for the default event handler, even if the method returns true.

  • IsVisibleOnPage(Int32)

    Returns whether or not the control is visible on the given page of the form. Used for form pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public bool IsVisibleOnPage (int pageNumber);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The page number.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the control is visible on the given page of the form; otherwise, false.

  • LoadPrivateViewState(Object)

    Loads private view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void LoadPrivateViewState (object state);

    Parameters

    • state
      Object

      Current view state of the control.

  • LoadViewState(Object)

    Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void LoadViewState (object savedState);

    Parameters

    • savedState
      Object

      An Object that represents the control state to be restored.

  • OnDataBinding(EventArgs)

    Raises the DataBinding event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnDataBinding (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

  • OnInit(EventArgs)

    Raises the Init event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnInit (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

  • OnLoad(EventArgs)

    Raises the Unload event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnLoad (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the control contains custom attributes and the current page does not allow custom attributes on controls.

    Remarks

    This method notifies the server control that it should perform actions common to each HTTP request for the page it is associated with, such as setting up a database query. At this stage in the page lifecycle, server controls in the hierarchy are created and initialized, view state is restored, and form controls reflect client-side data.

    Use the IsPostBack property to determine whether the page is being loaded in response to a client postback, or if it is being loaded and accessed for the first time.

  • OnPageChange(Int32,Int32)

    Paginates a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void OnPageChange (int oldPageIndex, int newPageIndex);

    Parameters

    • oldPageIndex
      Int32

      Contains the index number of the current page prior to pagination.

    • newPageIndex
      Int32

      Contains the index number of the current page after pagination.

    Remarks

    When all the contents of a control cannot be displayed on the browsing device's screen at once, this function is called to paginate the control. The index numbers are zero-based.

  • OnPreRender(EventArgs)

    Raises the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

  • OnRender(HtmlTextWriter)

    Renders a control to the specified output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void OnRender (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlTextWriter

      An HtmlTextWriter that will render the content.

  • OnUnload(EventArgs)

    Raises the Unload event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnUnload (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains event data.

  • PaginateRecursive(ControlPager)

    Paginates the control and its children. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual void PaginateRecursive (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager pager);

    Parameters

    • pager
      ControlPager

      The pager.

  • RemovedControl(Control)

    Called after a child control is removed from the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection of the Control object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void RemovedControl (System.Web.UI.Control control);

    Parameters

    • control
      System.Web.UI.Control

      The Control that has been removed.

  • Render(HtmlTextWriter)

    Sends server control content to a provided HtmlTextWriter object, which writes the content to be rendered on the client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void Render (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlTextWriter

      The HtmlTextWriter object that receives the server control content.

  • RenderChildren(HtmlTextWriter)

    Outputs the content of a server control's child controls using the provided HtmlTextWriter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public void RenderChildren (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlTextWriter

      The HtmlTextWriter object that receives the rendered content.

    Remarks

    This method iterates through the child controls and renders each control.

  • ResolveFormReference(String)

    Returns the form object referenced by the name parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form ResolveFormReference (string formID);

    Parameters

    • formID
      String

      Form object

    Returns

    • Form

      The form referenced by the name parameter.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      formID does not refer to an existing Form.

    Remarks

    If you have a link of the format "#form1" in a control contained in a user control, this method looks for a form with id=form1 in the user control. If not found, it goes up the chain of any nested user controls, and then searches for the form on the page.

    Note

    Scoping rules walk up, not down, the chain. If you want to browse to a form that is contained in a user control, you must use the ":" syntax used by FindControl method to refer to the form.

  • ResolveUrl(String)

    Converts a URL into one that is usable on the requesting client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string ResolveUrl (string relativeUrl);

    Parameters

    • relativeUrl
      String

      The URL to be resolved.

    Returns

    • String

      The value of the specified URL.

  • SavePrivateViewState()

    Saves any private view-state changes that have occurred since the page was loaded from persistence. If no changes were made, this method returns null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual object SavePrivateViewState ();

    Returns

    • Object

      An object containing the altered private view state.

    Remarks

    You can override this method to store a private view state. In addition to information saved with the ordinary view state, ASP.NET mobile Web Forms store information such as whether or not the form is paginated. This added information is stored in the private view state and is stored on the client rather than the server. A private view state is saved in an optimized manner. Default behavior, such as making the first form the active form, is never included in the saved private view state.

  • SaveViewState()

    Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override object SaveViewState ();

    Returns

    • Object

      Returns the server control's current view state. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns null.

  • SetAttribute(String,String)

    Designates an attribute and its value to assign to the MobileControl object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected void SetAttribute (string name, string value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      A String signifying the key of the attribute to be set.

    • value
      String

      A String to be assigned as the value of the attribute.

    Remarks

    The attributes set through calls to the SetAttribute method are stored in the CustomAttributes property.

  • TrackViewState()

    Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void TrackViewState ();

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute(String)

    For a description of this method, see stem.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    string IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the attribute to get.

    Returns

    • String

      The value of the specified attribute.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileControl instance is cast to an IAttributeAccessor interface.

  • IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute(String,String)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    void IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute (string name, string value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name specifying the attribute to be set.

    • value
      String

      The value to be set.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileControl instance is cast to an IAttributeAccessor interface.
